sen.j: 七条通（しちじょうどおり）は京都市の主要な東西の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Shichijo-dori Street is one of the major east-west running streets in Kyoto City.
Shichijo-dori Street is one of the major east-west streets in Kyoto City.
Shichijo-dori Street is one of the major east-west streets in Kyoto City.

sen.j: 平安京の七条大路にあたる。
sen.e: The street corresponds to the Shichijo-oji Street in Heiankyo.
The street corresponds to Shichijo-oji Street in Heiankyo.
The street corresponds to Shichijo-oji Street in Heiankyo.

sen.j: 東は東大路通との交差点、東山七条が起点。
sen.e: The east end is the crossing with Higashioji-dori Street, Higashiyama-shichijo.
The eastern end is the crossing with Higashioji-dori Street, Higashiyama-shichijo.
The eastern end is the crossing with Higashioji-dori Street, Higashiyama-shichijo.

sen.j: 西は葛野大路通を越えて南に曲がり桂川 (淀川水系)に架かる桂大橋東詰で八条通と合流する。
sen.e: In the west, the street turns south after crossing the Kadonoji-dori Street and merges with the Hachijo-dori Street at the east end of Katsura-Ohashi Bridge that straddles the Katsura River (Yodo-gawa water system).

In the west, the street turns south after crossing Kadonoji-dori Street and merges with Hachijo-dori Street at the eastern end of Katsura-Ohashi Bridge, which straddles the Katsura River (Yodo-gawa Water System).

In the west, the street turns south after crossing Kadonoji-dori Street and merges with Hachijo-dori Street at the eastern end of Katsura-Ohashi Bridge, which straddles the Katsura River (Yodo-gawa Water System).

sen.j: 西の末端部は山陰街道である。
sen.e: Its west end is the Sanin-kaido Road.
Its western end is Sanin-kaido Road.
Its western end is Sanin-kaido Road.

sen.j: 近世においては、現在の七条千本付近が洛中・洛外の境界であり、そこから七条通を西に延ばす形で山陰街道が続いていた。
sen.e: In the medieval age, the border between Rakuchu and Rakugai is around Nanajo-Senbon, from which the Sanin-kaido Road ran in a manner that the Shichijo-dori Street was extended west.
During the medieval period, the border between Rakuchu and Rakugai was around Nanajo-Senbon, from which Sanin-kaido Road ran in such a manner that Shichijo-dori Street was extended west.
During modern times, the border between Rakuchu and Rakugai was around Nanajo-Senbon, from which Sanin-kaido Road ran in such a manner that Shichijo-dori Street was extended westward.

sen.j: 明治末期の京都市三大事業によって東大路通から大宮通まで、その後の大正 - 昭和初期の都市計画事業によって西は西大路通までが拡幅され、京都市電が敷設された。
sen.e: In the late Meiji era, the street was widened between the Todaiji-dori Street and the Omiya-dori Street according to the three major city plans of Kyoto City; later according to a city plan in Taisho and early Showa era, the western end of the wide street extended to the Nishioji-dori Street to lay out rails of Kyoto City trams.

However, in the late Meiji period the street was widened between Todaiji-dori Street and Omiya-dori Street according to the three major city plans of Kyoto City; later according to a city plan in the Taisho and early Showa eras, the western end of the wide street was extended to Nishioji-dori Street in order to lay the rails for Kyoto City trams.

However, in the late Meiji period the street was widened between Higashioji-dori Street and Omiya-dori Street according to the three major city plans of Kyoto City; later, according to a city plan in the Taisho and early Showa eras, the western end of the wide street was extended to Nishioji-dori Street in order to lay the rails for Kyoto City trams.

sen.j: そのため、西大路通以西は道幅が細くなっており、桂大橋の東側や山陰街道（旧山陰街道）の樫原付近では旧街道の面影が残されている。
sen.e: As the result, the street west of the Nishioji-dori Street is still narrow but there retain traces of the Historic Highway in the east side of the Ktsura Ohashi Bridge or around Katagihara on the Sanin-kaido Road (Old Sanin-kaido Road).

Consequently, the street west of Nishioji-dori Street is still narrow but there remain traces of the Historic Highway in the east side of Katsura Ohashi Bridge or around Katagihara on Sanin-kaido Road (Old Sanin-kaido Road).

Consequently, the street west of Nishioji-dori Street is still narrow but there remain traces of the Historic Highway in the east side of Katsura Ohashi Bridge or around Katagihara on Sanin-kaido Road (Old Sanin-kaido Road).

sen.j: 東山七条付近に京都国立博物館、三十三間堂、智積院、養源院がある。
sen.e: Kyoto National Museum, Sanjusangendo Temple, Chishakuin, and Yogenin are located around Higashiyama-shichijo.
Kyoto National Museum, Sanjusangendo Temple, Chishakuin and Yogenin are located in the vicinity of Higashiyama-shichijo.
Kyoto National Museum, Sanjusangendo Temple, Chishakuin and Yogenin are located in the vicinity of Higashiyama-shichijo.

sen.j: また烏丸七条上ルに東本願寺、堀川七条上ルに西本願寺がある。
sen.e: Higashi Hongan-ji Temple is at Horikawa-Shichijo-agaru and Nishi hongan-ji Temple is Horikawa-Shichijo-agaru.
Higashi Hongan-ji Temple is found at Horikawa-Shichijo-agaru, and Nishi hongan-ji Temple is at Horikawa-Shichijo-agaru.
Higashi Hongan-ji Temple is found at Karasuma-Shichijo-agaru, and Nishi hongan-ji Temple is located at Horikawa-Shichijo-agaru.

sen.j: 千本七条には京の台所である京都市中央卸売市場第一市場がある。
sen.e: First market, Kyoto City central wholesale market, the kitchen of Kyoto People, is on Senbon-nanajo.
The first market--Kyoto City Central Wholesale Market--the kitchen of Kyoto people, is on Senbon-nanajo.
The first market, Kyoto City Central Wholesale Market, the "kitchen of Kyoto's people," is on Senbon-nanajo.

sen.j: この付近は道幅が広く通りに沿って駐車スペースが設けられている。
sen.e: Around the market, the street is wide with parking lots are on the both sides of the street.
Around the market, the street is wide with parking lots on both sides.
Around the market, the street is wide with parking lots on both sides.

sen.j: なお、「七条」の正しい読みは「しちじょう」だが、地元の人々には「ひちじょう」もしくは「ひっちょう」と読まれることもある。
sen.e: The correct pronunciation of “七条” is Shichijo but local people may pronounce “Hichijo” or “Hiccho.
The correct pronunciation of “七条” is "Shichijo," but local people may pronounce it as “Hichijo” or “Hiccho."
The correct pronunciation of '七条' is 'Shichijo,' but local people may pronounce it as 'Hichijo' or 'Hiccho.

sen.j: なお、京都市営バスのバス停留所名で七条を冠したものはあえて「ななじょう」と読ませている。
sen.e: On City buses, bus stops staring with “七条” are pronounced "Nanajo" on purpose.,
On the city buses, bus stops starting with “七条” are intentionally pronounced "Nanajo."
On the city buses, bus stops starting with 七条 are intentionally pronounced 'Nanajo.'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」にあわせ"を'に原文に『』のない" "を削除

sen.j: 一条通との間違いを避けるためと説明される。
sen.e: The purpose is to prevent mishears with "Ichijo" of the Ichijo-dori Street.
The purpose is to prevent any confusion with the "Ichijo" of Ichijo-dori Street.
The purpose is to prevent any confusion with the "Ichijo" of Ichijo-dori Street.

sen.j: 交差する道路などの特記がないものは市町村道。
sen.e: Roads unless specified are operated by local municipalities.
Roads are operated by local municipalities unless otherwise specified.
Roads are operated by local municipalities unless otherwise specified.
